document.title: Cambridge Assessment International Education, Curriculum Frame Work, Cambridge Primary English 0058

9106975689C746C28BECF9153B38B474.description: Suggest how someone's non-verbal communication reflects their feelings.

7BB8E15450754AEC82A4D53025AA01AB.description: Talk about own activities, including what they enjoyed.

4ACFF2B2EC3C49958BAEB408D68D08DD.description: Make a simple personal statement in a familiar context.

E883709FE236404D91474DEC53157BCF.description: Engage in imaginative play, enacting simple characters or situations.

2061B481AA6B4B279C4E3B2256D6D311.description: Pause at full stops when reading aloud.

0152871700234A4F8B318B8A0C92D254.description: Recite simple poems, showing awareness of rhythm.

74E566BE66BD4B988CAD5B30E896D123.description: Re-read sentences aloud with some fluency and expression.

69AF5FFD0BA14B7E9A24FCA852F17E86.description: Take turns in speaking, expressing own feelings and ideas.

94BD2E92B23645D58AE5BA66D6AB1780.description: During a discussion, listen to others without interrupting.

0BF9D10AC6BC457A8993CA6F0AD3CE4B.description: Show understanding of the opinions of others.

96A9F5C2F5CC40889DB4059F8FE48005.description: Work with others in a group.

5C827BB76F744956BA6E7E1A9E97FB9C.description: Ask simple questions about what is heard or read.

4DF01AB3B6114437973BAAE4500C9078.description: Listen and respond appropriately, including following a sequence of simple instructions.

0598B3542A9C4798BCE1F67218B53419.description: Show some awareness of the listener, e.g. by varying tone to engage them, by responding to their non-verbal cues.

CECB9018F36A41EDA5D8D12046F234E9.description: Show some use of non-verbal communication techniques.

C4801C6229B9466A974D0167097A478B.description: Use some relevant vocabulary to describe events and feelings.

D60BC3C64B974DCABE50905A87E8D8D3.description: Speak audibly and clearly with familiar people.

C3148A18E9334850BF33F468A8746868.description: Read own writing aloud and talk about it.

1B3A504EDA3342FA919A2A64A69C4005.description:
Present text in a range of different ways, e.g. diagrams with typed
labels, storyboards with handwritten captions.

B509242072534465B228DC9DBA63546B.description: Record answers to simple questions about texts, e.g. in lists.

B8FB639983D74F66B2CE9DF5A2DAC283.description:
Join some letters, including to support use of multi-letter
graphemes.

69B3998834714C13A14B29D3ACFFF093.description: Form lower-case and upper-case letters correctly.

123B69E226AC4F8BB0803ACE93CDD2A8.description: Develop a comfortable and efficient pencil grip.

DC911BCF5B754418984CB3F7A88A3C0F.description:
Include some relevant information when writing simple non-fiction
texts in familiar real-life contexts.

4FB74BB731C84E9B9AAE9D7C02060235.description:
Begin to write for a purpose using basic language and features
appropriate for the text type.

DAE3BA2AF48D48E4A9D8F0AB7E0858C0.description:
Develop a short written retelling of a familiar story, e.g. by writing
sentences to caption pictures.

96F19F83B9434C8BBF5EEA473C21234C.description:
Plan writing by speaking aloud, e.g. saying sentences or describing
a sequence of events before writing them.

B195463CB9C14C84B289E26A9F551DCF.description:
Begin to write simple stories and poems, including using the
structures of familiar stories and poems.

BC68DFEAEA2143EE9C2C861F77A8FFDC.description:
Use simple organisational features appropriate to the text type,
e.g. subheadings, labelled diagrams.

2BCA0ECFA1AF4FEF9065B629AE668432.description:
Develop a simple sequence of known actions or events, e.g. by
ordering sentences and then adding to them.

1D99D163B8904CD78A73C62D567BC28A.description: Use articles the and a or an appropriately in sentences.

071030FA17634A30A8341F96A9A2A7C6.description: Use and to join words and clauses.

8141409572A540C3B9F39D6DB40D1A74.description:
Use a capital letter for 'I', for proper nouns and to start some
sentences in more extended writing.

82138A0EA2874C3794D76C831BFDF36E.description: In more extended writing, end some sentences with a full stop.

5015EBFE41D54552AC34947FE3E4FAAD.description: Use a capital letter and full stop to start and end a sentence.

99012257210F42F4BF69FB9ECC5E5758.description:
Use own lists of interesting and significant words to extend the
range of vocabulary used in written work.

591B0B7EBB2C4559BF0EB857BA30DAEA.description: Begin to use some formulaic language, e.g. Once upon a time ...

72943F7E5DB049319BD8B7D9D2FA542F.description: Use vocabulary relevant to a familiar topic.

C2B25420BDF94E36AA06A3BB3970C3FD.description:
Ask for support in spelling unfamiliar words and use spelling logs
to support future writing.

F8F60688CAC44380B727EB8DE302ED0B.description:
Spell familiar words accurately, including common exception
words.

631EB75DF4BF4E8094A00346E95DFACC.description:
Choose plausible graphemes that match phonemes to write
simple regular words and to attempt other words.

05298A5B77FE4BE2B5CB3A55A3BCCC13.description:
Explore and use plural nouns with endings -s and -es, and
understand the effect on the meaning of a noun of adding these endings.

01F29A594A354B7D977AD26E32542157.description: Relate rhyme to shared spelling patterns, e.g. rock, clock, sock.

56C52515CDDE4002BA8126D00C5BB55E.description:
Identify letters (graphemes) for adjacent consonants (e.g. br, nd)
and consonant digraphs, including th, ch and sh.

88321100265B47A092E09209AB540647.description:
Identify the most common letter(s) (grapheme(s)) associated with
each sound in the English language.

871D4A17E8E4428A9D9C8DE553F7E4A9.description: Begin to identify how contexts and events in stories are the same as or different from real life.

E8EE5F832EA24FB29D303232B2F8A282.description: Begin to make choices about books to read or listen to for pleasure.

BE76E4A02FAD4A4D80833ECB0A90B8C2.description: Talk about texts heard or read, including making links with own experiences and expressing likes and dislikes.

9DB6C0A2D9894C85B47CD554E924A0C7.description: Join in with some words and phrases when reading familiar simple stories and poems together.

072169694A814AB292DA51CE70CA58BF.description: Enjoy reading and hearing a range of simple stories, poems and non-fiction texts.

70097C7097904B569918CC8E035B4F6F.description: Show understanding of rhyme and repetition when joining in with reading familiar simple stories and poems.

8D744599C19E420C89E37A8B7E29FD95.description: Answer questions about texts with some explanation of thinking.

1B8C94AC95CE4E43AEBBC2524258034B.description: Respond verbally to simple questions about texts read or heard.

FC74ED69DBE34A01B3776EFEE4CC6550.description: Make simple inferences based on events in a text.

7B07EF24C7CB4FB5913D7EF3C4117753.description: Anticipate what happens next in a story.

FEEADA1D6A0C4E25BA152DA122E70A30.description: Explore implicit meanings in simple texts.

C706E77064E64478AFD4E45DA380664F.description: Find information by reading labels, lists and captions.

48AE80C3D2244ECE8EAB11D5CE1E16CB.description: Identify the main characters in a story and talk about what happens to them.

EF367159113341DCB31E22A760A1926C.description: Retell a familiar story verbally, including most of the relevant information.

7CC1F63593544D7AB6D83A84D28745E9.description: Explore explicit meanings in simple texts.

C428494E58C843E8A56BB524AFF7743B.description: Begin to show awareness that different non-fiction text types have different purposes and begin to identify their features.

C09BA9BAF7084B8EB7BE5A175D5E010B.description: Read and explore a range of simple non-fiction text types.

34EAE9F7E8474508A0ECD9E582D3AA8F.description: Identify the characteristics of simple stories.

C0AC55FB4AFE41B3915C15BD77026DB8.description: Read and explore a range of simple stories and poems, including identifying the contribution of any visual elements.

116423E4FF974081B52335664C7BBA51.description: Explore and recognise how texts for different purposes look different, e.g. different uses of pictures.

908AA1B769744B44BB15C6FF3B525AB8.description: Explore and recognise parts of a book, including cover, title and contents.

5396F8EE61FD40EA85C484BA33D7E6A1.description: Explore and recognise the features of text structure in a range of different fiction and non-fiction texts, including simple poems.

FE62C450F9C14E1DB779093BCDF33965.description: Talk about the sequence of events or actions in a text, e.g. what happens at the beginning, in the middle and at the end of a story.

88C196E7A89B43F59E36B49C81D6073F.description: Explore, and understand, the use of articles the and a or an in sentences.

F13E9F09605B43BB8F65252424DCD32F.description: Explore in texts examples of nouns and verbs.

797F79CF303041CEAD3C730F59F68B2F.description: Explore in texts, and understand, the grammar of statements, including the importance of verbs and word order.

17C90C43C9394868AECF45119A91B6B3.description: Explore in texts sentences that contain and.

28BF20A81D094BDFAF42DB056FC2A8F7.description: Explore in texts, and understand, the use of full stops and different uses of capital letters.

51473B8CE41E436FAF60601165C95A60.description: Re-read text showing understanding of capital letters and full stops to indicate sentences, and simple grammatical links between words, e.g. [The girl] [is playing] with [her ball].

17868B48F21F4A9BA2B4A3FAAE9F07DE.description: Explore sounds and words in texts, e.g. rhyming words, rhythm.

44182FCF34214266AB29A56A7AC46B55.description: Identify and record interesting and significant words from texts to inform own writing.

6FF24412BA0A4509B2EF35C6EBFB829F.description: Use pictures in texts as cues to support understanding of unfamiliar words

A53E55B499134114B73955A5C839B573.description: Begin to show understanding of words and sentences encountered in reading.

DA7923A9DD4E4619B1794ABA79CB8D54.description: Begin to recognise a range of common words on sight, including common exception words.

87E36402048F4F1C9DC9743B9BB954F9.description: Use phonic knowledge to sound out some elements of unfamiliar words.

8C65CE8558CD4AD8BAD0DF7F3A2176E8.description: Use phonic knowledge to read decodable words.

5C791C4C6BD04B70A4441AACF02DB7FE.description: Blend to identify the sounds represented by adjacent consonants, e.g. br, nd.

69495145AD2349E5892F55BDD416257D.description: Identify the sounds (phonemes) represented by more than one letter (consonant digraphs; vowel digraphs; trigraphs, e.g. th, sh, ch; ai, ee; igh).

08EC205B95124899BEE1882C23F2CD3E.description: Know the name of each letter in the English alphabet and the most common sound (phoneme) associated with it.
